verses.text: Shall not my soul be subjected to God? for of him is my salvation.
For he is my God, and my savior; my helper, I shall not be moved \f + \fr 61:2 \fl Or, \ft any more. \f* very much.
How long will you⌃ assault a man? you⌃ are all slaughtering as with a bowed wall and a broken hedge.
They only took counsel to set at nothing my honor: I ran in thirst: with their mouth they blessed, but with their heart they cursed. Pause.
Nevertheless do you, my soul, be subjected to God; for of him \add is\add* my patient hope.
For he \add is\add* my God and my Saviour; my helper, I shall not be moved.
\f + \fr 61:7 \fl Gr. \ft on. \f* In God \add is\add* my salvation and my glory: \add he is\add* the God of my help, and my hope is in God.
Hope in him, all you⌃ congregation of the people; pour out your hearts before him, for God is our helper. Pause.
But the sons of men are vain; the sons of men are false, so as to be deceitful in the balances; they are \f + \fr 61:9 \fl Gr. \ft altogether. \f* all alike \add formed\add* out of vanity.
Trust not in unrighteousness, and lust not after robberies: if wealth should flow in, set not your heart upon it.
God has spoken once, \add and\add* I have heard these two things, that power is of God;
and mercy is your, O Lord; for you will recompense every one according to his works.
